title: Former MasterChef judge Gary Mehigan sports unkempt beard during lunch date with wife Mandy
text:
He was ousted from MasterChef alongside fellow judges Matt Preston and George Calombaris back in July.

But it appears Gary Mehigan is enjoying some time away from work, as he was spotted sporting a rather different look while out with wife Mandy on Wednesday.

The 52-year-old restaurateur was seen looking much more casual than his usual clean-shaven self, as he donned a distinguished grey beard during the outing in Melbourne.

Enjoying the time off? Gary Mehigan (pictured) looked less like his well-shaven self for the outing on Wednesday, days after the new MasterChef Australia line-up was confirmed

The author looked content as he held his wife's hand for the sweet lunch date, sporting a smart navy blazer with a spotted purple shirt underneath.

He teamed the look with a pair of beige chinos, while wearing a pair of black thick-rimmed spectacles on his face.

Meanwhile, his supportive wife sported a stylish summer dress which she teamed with a floaty pink blazer.

Standing proud: Gary was spotted holding hands with his doting wife Mandy (right) following a difficult few weeks, as the pair headed for a lunch date in Melbourne

'We needed space to stretch our legs and do our own thing' Gary recently revealed his version of events as to why the trio left MasterChef, saying it had nothing to do with money

Super stylish: Gary's supportive wife was spotted sporting a stylish summer dress she teamed with a floaty pink blazer, completing her look with a pair of suede ankle boots

It's official! Channel 10 has confirmed the new judges on MasterChef Australia will be Andy Allen (left) Melissa Leong (centre) and Jock Zonfrillo (right)

Only last week, it was confirmed by Channel 10 that the show's new judges would be Andy Allen, Melissa Leong and Jock Zonfrillo.

The long-awaited announcement came after Gary, Matt and George chose to walk away from the program, reportedly after Ten refused to give them a significant pay rise.

However, Gary later claimed the reports to be incorrect, telling the Sydney Morning Herald: 'There's the 'three greedy judges' narrative, and then there's the reality.

'There's the 'three greedy judges' narrative, and then there's the reality' Gary vehemently denied claims the trio were in arguments over money

'Limited our ability': Gary recently claimed he and fellow judges Matt Preston and George Calombaris wanted to explore other avenues away from MasterChef

A fresh start: Gary had been on MasterChef for the past 11 years, with Channel 10 thanking him, George and Matt in a statement earlier in the year

'We needed space to stretch our legs and do our own thing... [the contract from Ten] would have limited our ability to do other things.'

In a statement, Ten's CEO Paul Anderson claimed the decision to axe the three judges came after months of failed negotiations.

Mr Anderson said: 'Despite months of negotiations, Ten has not been able to reach a commercial agreement that was satisfactory to Matt, Gary and George.

'We would like to thank Gary, George and Matt for their contribution over the past 11 years.'
description: Gary Mehigan is enjoying some time away from work following his exit from MasterChef, as he was spotted sporting a rather different look while out with wife Mandy on Wednesday.
authors: Nicole Douglas For Daily Mail Australia
